Key Match Events: The Dodgers came back twice late to win Game 1.
The Dodgers won Game 2 with a score of 4-2.
Shohei Ohtani sustained a subluxation of his left shoulder.
Yoshinobu Yamamoto outpitched Carlos Rodon in Game 2.
Freddie Freeman hit a walk-off grand slam in Game 1.
Teoscar Hernandez hit a two-run homer in Game 2.
Freddie Freeman hit his fourth homer in his last four World Series games.
Aaron Judge went 0-for-4 with three strikeouts in Game 2.
Pre-Game Insights: Anthony Rizzo mentioned that a win on Monday could change the narrative.
The Yankees were expected to have an advantage in the rotation, but it did not materialize.
The Yankees' offseason plan included acquiring Juan Soto and Yoshinobu Yamamoto, but Yamamoto chose to team with Ohtani.
The Yankees wanted Jack Flaherty and Tommy Edman at the trade deadline, but the Dodgers acquired both.
Post-Match Reflections: Anthony Rizzo expressed confidence that the series is far from over.
Aaron Boone emphasized the need to make the series a long one.
